basics.name: John Buhay
basics.label: DevOps Engineer
basics.summary: I have been charged with developing efficient and maintainable products using cutting-edge technologies in the open-source / linux space. I am passionate about building solutions for development teams to be able to manage, deploy, analyze and improve their products.

highlights: Built and improving a CICD pipeline with Kubernetes (a Docker cluster management tool developed by Google)
Actively developing Infrastructure-AAS with Ansible to support all teams with their environment configuration needs while driving code as configuration initiative and requirement
Design tools for teams to manage their own builds, tests and deployments using the latest technology

work.position: Engineering Lead for Franchise Marketing and Microsite Projects / Engineering
work.summary: Responsible for deployment of time sensitive content for the Franchise Marketing and Microsite mobile sites
highlights: Eliminated hours of work in a weekly sprint iteration by automating HTML generation using node.js
Automated the delivery pipeline through the entire SDLC process using git flow, Jenkins, and Ctrl-M
Managed the ADA (American Disabilities Act) Compliance Project for Engineering
Responsible for troubleshooting, implementing and validating hot fixes for production issues
Performed site validation prior to comprehensive QA testing
Continued to advise and support Content Operations on complex issues

work.position: Project Coordinator, eCommerce and CMS Application Lead / Content Operations
work.summary: Managed projects involving multiple teams for feature development, marketing campaigns, eCommerce sales, advertising and content maintenance for US and 10 international subscription sites, 3 multilingual sites and 10 non-subscription sites
highlights: Improved the Weight Tracker design by creating a CMS managed web-app (a fundamental tool for millions of online subscribers in all 12 subscription sites including 3 multilingual countries)

Enhanced visitor experience by leveraging existing web services to provide content dynamically to customer targets which increased the user time on site and the number of ad impressions while alleviating hours of repetitive work completed by Content Entry team
Provided CMS expertise in the design and implementation of the new signup process in 2009 to our front-end and back-end developers
Developed front-end changes to customize the IBM WebSphere eCommerce platform to improve customer experience and drive online product sales
Managed the Marketing, eCommerce and Engineering teams to deliver seamless store availability and marketing campaigns to our local and international subscribers
Tracked task performance, completion and quality

education.institution: New York University SCPS, New York, NY
